Reviews.Title: “Take the bus somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Aaron J
Reviews.Content: I am a fairly big man i have stayed here about 3 times because its cheap but unfortunatley last weekend was my last stay i stayed for 2 nights the first room they put me in was so small my legs would have been sticking out on the end tv was practically touching the bed i called down to the front desk they said all the rooms are the same size i told them upgrade me to a king i was to tired to go anywhere the next room was fine but when i went to check out my 50 dollar deposit was refused to give back to me because i changed rooms i left and am making a formal complaint the showers were not the best stay somewhere else and do not let them have your credit card number

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson Toronto Lakeshore Experience”
Reviews.Author: Phil S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Howard Johnson Hotel on Roncesvalles Avenue and truly enjoyed it. The staff are friendly, the room was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was more than adequate and the manager was a thorough gentleman. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. Moreover, it is located in a very convenient location, where it is easy to catch a tram on Queen or King Streets into Toronto. I'm from Australia, and when I next visit Toronto, I will most definitely be staying at the Howard Johnson on the Lakeshore. Phil.

Reviews.Title: “very small room, window cracked”
Reviews.Author: Kristina1124
Reviews.Content: My daughter I and I stayed here for 3 nights several years ago. What they don't tell you is that the city buses park in the back. The parking was a good 3 blocks away in a creepy locked garage. The breakfast was in a small restaurant next door and was ok. The front desk people were nice enough, but the overall hotel experience was sad. Our room faced the street and our front window was cracked. We never walked anywhere as we were quite far from downtown. We did walk across the bridge to the lake and investigated a bit, but we didn't venture out too far in the immediate area except to walk to our car. We took the trolly to town once and that was ok, but if I went back to Toronto, I would definitely stay closer to town. The original photo I saw on the website really isn't what it really looked like. They had photoshopped all the wires out, so I attached a real photo! We actually went in 2007, but I didn't think to review it until now...from the other reviews I have read that were more recent things haven't changed there (except the name).

Reviews.Title: “How does health and Safety allow this hotel to stay opened?”
Reviews.Author: Irishsakani
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience of my life. I couldn't even stay in the room, the smell was awful, the streets were cleaner than this room, there was even fly's all over the room and bathroom. Don't take a risk with this one like we did. The other reviewers are not hard to please, it really is that bad! "Five minutes from all places that matter in the city of Toronto" my backside. When we asked the cab driver to take us from downtown to the hotel he laughed and asked why we booked that place. He said we could have got a much nicer place in downtown for the same price. When we arrived, we were told we were upgraded to 2 bed's as they didn't have a non-smoking king room left like we had booked. But it was still a non smoking room. Seemed ok so we agreed. We got to the room and after gagging at the smell, I opened the curtains to the dirty scummy window and it just made everything worse. If this was an upgrade, what was the other room like?! The bathroom was rotten, pubic hairs all over the floor and the shower curtain was stained. The carpet in the room was patchy and there was blood splatters on the wall paper and lots of other stains. I spent the entire stay (about 15 mins) swatting flies away! We checked the beds before making our final decision to stay/go... and the base of the bed has stains all over it, the bedclothes were stained, and the gold duvets had wet patches on it. There was pubic hairs on the bed, long dark hairs and long blonde hairs. The 2 beds were similar. We went to reception and asked if we were put into the wrong room as this didn't seem to be cleaned since its last occupants and the arguing started. I was told it wasn't a luxury hotel and I was expecting too much (I thought a clean bed was the norm in hotels regardless of rating??). He told me this was clean and the cleaner had serviced the room that morning. I asked him to come to the room and have a look, when I pointed out the hairs on the beds, he swept them to the already dirty carpet and said there was nothing wrong with the bed and as they were a budget hotel, they couldn't afford to have high quality bed linen and towels. All I expected was something clean. He was extremely unhelpful and argumentative. He said they didn't have another room for us that night as they were all occupied. I asked for a refund and he said this was not possible. We were booked for 3 nights and this wasn't an option to stay here. He said we could talk to his manager the next day but there was nothing he could do. I pointed out that there were wet stains on the bedclothes and he lifted them saying he would send them to laundry (eh... was this not done anyway?!) After deciding we couldn't stay in that room, we took our bags back to reception and asked for alternative arrangements to be made, which was refused. It was 7pm and all we could from get was that we needed to speak to the manager the next day. The guy then took us to a room to prove that the hotel rooms were cleaned.... we still weren't impressed by this, although a bit better.... but we couldn't have that room as someone else had already booked it. Strangest and rudest experience we have ever had with any hotel in North America, India, Africa or Europe. Needless to say, for an extra $10 a night, we got a lovely 4* in downtown. Howard Johnston kept 1 full nights cost and refunded the other 2 nights. The manager was still extremely rude and argumentative.

Reviews.Title: “Just, not very good.”
Reviews.Author: brokenarm22
Reviews.Content: When we got to the room, the carpets were still wet from a shampoo. Also, it smelled. The staff was kind and the continental breakfast was OK. The location was right near the lake and it wasn't TOO far from downtown, but I would try to find a better hotel if I ever go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: whitetip30
Reviews.Content: parking was a big pain in the but, but room was nice we got a king size bed, plus extra bed, the bathroom was big enough to fit a queen size bed, staff was helpful would stay again

Reviews.Title: “DON'T RUIN YOUR VACATION”
Reviews.Author: KledsonPires
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny. You had to be starved to eat their breakfast. Terrible location. There is no place to dine, have breakfast or lunch nearby. It isn't very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Dull and dated”
Reviews.Author: Superteds
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 1.5 hour walk from CNN tower or a 50 min ride on the street car in traffic. Rooms were very dark and the huge desk, chair and tv cabinet served no purpose but to take up space. Hotel was very clean though. My husband and I are travelling for 6 months but otherwise we would not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Total Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: BotroitRedWings
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August of 2006, I know the title says 2010, but no 2006 available. The hotel was a disaster. When we pulled up to the hotel, the place was located in the ghetto. They said parking wasnt a problem, but you had to park in an old apartment parking garage 2 blocks away. Not great when youre walking in a freaking ghetto. Which brings me to a scary story. My dad was walking back to the hotel when he was ran at by some guy with a needle. Turns out this guy escaped the hospital and couldnt find his way back, which is close to the hotel. When we got in our rooms, they were TINY. There was garbage and dirt all over the place, as well as old matches and cigarette butt burns on the counter tops. The shower i couldnt touch. It had hair all in it and there was mildew or some kind of growing mess in there. Location? Cant beat it! If you love Tram cars coming in and out at 4 in the morning! Our view was spectacular! We got a view of a graffiti filled sign with profanity on them. The hotel staff was rediculous, the guy working spoke very little english and was playing nintendo DS instead of working...? The hotel tells you that youre minutes in walking distance to the CN tower and rogers centre. DONT BE FOOLED. You need to take a 10 min trolley ride. A total dump. I would never return if my life was on the line.

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: JessMacLeod
Reviews.Content: The hotel smells like stale smoke. The room was not clean, there was hair on the bathroom floor and mold in the garbage. The rooms are very small and I refused to take off my shoes. It is unclean and the staff are unfriendly. Also, the area of town is shady. I was chased just outside of the hotel by some random guy. This place is not safe. I expected someone to barge into the room in the middle of the night or see people walking away with video cameras and lights from shooting a "film" in the next room. Awful. I'd rather sleep in my car.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY AT ALL COST.....”
Reviews.Author: tk_jnr
Reviews.Content: Truly the worst hotel experience of my life.. and I travel quite a bit. My friends and I booked this hotel for 5 nights (what a BAAAD choice). Located in the ghetto of Toronto. Whether you book last minute or in advance, it is non-refundable or exchangeable.. not surprising because once you get there you will want to leave. The bed sheets had stains (big ones) and the bath had hair all around. ALL the rooms smelt of smoke, even the non smoking ones. Everything about this hotel is filthy and false, there is a big sign that says breakfast is between 0730-1100 and when we came down after a sleepless night due to someone breaking into the room at 0230. And the noise coming from the bus station located directly behind the hotel. The manager told us breakfast finishes at 10:00. We complained to the manager about the state of the room and he said "this is a non-refundable room, may be try and find another hotel" and that is what we did. The manager is very arrogant and unhelpful. After only one night here we checked out and booked into Novotel on the other side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Sage Advice from Distress Traveller-- Aviod Lakeshore HOJO”
Reviews.Author: DistressedTraveller
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir//Mam, Please post this on your website to help other Travellers. HOJO at 14 Roncesvalles Ave Toronto, ON M6R 2K3 This is a Really Terrible place to live. Please watch out for the following. Rude hotel staff, extremely dirty carpet (check carpet color INSIDE the ROOM versus OUTSIDE the room). Outside the room the carpet is clean, but inside the room the carpet is stained with black shoe and feces marks (never washed!!!). The comforter and the sheet underneath had the stains when I asked for the new comforter, i was given sheets in exchange. The size of their pillow is the size of the Diameter of your Head!!! Thatâ€™s it. There is a stain going from the side of the mattress all the way to the edge of the bed all the way to the carpet. Patches of these stains were on the carpet. DO NOT trust the size of the rooms you see in a picture or photo. The ROOMS are Extremely TINY!!! Online advertisement will talk about in room safe. There is NO SAFE. Online advertisement will describe clean shower. I found pubic hair on the hair drier!!. When I brought to the attention of the staff, they did NOTHING. Area where the hotel is located is very dangerous. Please be careful with you possessions. There was NO fitness center. NO Parking facility, NO SAFETY DEPOSITE BOX, No CYCLING!!! There is CONTINOUS LOUD NOISE from the Street Car (similar to light rail/Tram) ALL DAY and NIGHT. It is really a terrible hotel please STAY AWAY because for a $10.00 difference they will rip you off saying "WE DID NOT PUT THE ADVERTISEMENT, the websites did. Complaint to the website not to us" Sincerely Distressed Traveler who lived at HOJO 14 Roncesvalles Ave Toronto, ON M6R 2K3 and became sick upon reaching home.

Reviews.Title: “VERY noisy!!! Bring earplugs.”
Reviews.Author: Gen16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, our room was located on the side of Roncevalles street. It was almost as if we were sleeping directly IN the streets, the noise of the streetcars was so loud, even with earplugs I had a hard time sleeping. Forget about putting on the fan of the air conditionning to reduce the noise...it made it worst it sounded as if we had an airplane in the room. We decided to stay since we had already paid AND we taught that we got what we paid for...what could we expect for 55$/ night in Toronto? If it wasn't for the noise, we wouldn't have mind staying there since the location wasn't too bad and the price was quite good for Toronto. We had a double bed which was ok.The room was tiny. It was ok for cleanliness, carpet was clean and bathroom was clean also. There is no elevator and the parking is 2 blocks away. The hotel is located within 20 minutes of downtown Toronto by streetcars (501 and 504). Breakfast was ok (Waffles, bagels, toasts, cereals, jams, cream cheese, juices and coffee, apples). I've read some comments saying the hotel was located in the ghetto...it's not the ghetto, it's not a rich area that's all.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: greeneye50
Reviews.Content: We got here on the 14th of march 2011 and we must say the hotel didn't actually look that shabby from the outside, even though the neighborhood is a little Ghettolike! Anyways, the receptionist was unfriendly and actually only paid attention once and that was when it came to pay the 50 cad deposit. The room was located at the 3rd floor and since there was no elevator we had to carry our 3 big suitcases all the way up without any kind of help offered whatsoever. We were yelled and insulted at by a drunk man who came down the stairs right by the reception desk and nobody even thought of interfering . Once we got into the room, we couldn't believe our eyes. The carpet along the stairs all the way towards the room was already the most disgusting thing we've ever seen but the one in the room topped it. There were stains with the size of a spaghetti bowl, mold stains on the bathroom curtain, on the pillow on the sheets and on the wall. It was announced as a double but it was too small even for a single. We went downstairs to complain but the manager wasn't there so there was nothing she could do. On the next morning we tried to have breakfast but since there was nothing but a waffle maker, we skipped that. Unfortunately the manager wasn't there again so we left to get a new place. Once we found one we took our stuff and left. The room hasn't been cleaned in the morning either. We called the manger the next morning, who turned out to be a very rude, unreasonable and uneducated person. He wouldn't let me finish one sentence and referred to his policy there is no way to get a refund about 5 times during that conversation. All in all THIS HOTEL IS A SCAM!!! and we can only highly recommend you not to go there, not even for a dollar a day!!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: asd111
Reviews.Content: i have not seen a front desk staff like that,,he was so terrible,,the rudest ever he didn't even let me talk yelling at me on the phone there is noway to talk with him on the phone.i was trying to explain him something he didn't want to listen and put me hold 3 4 times.who ever reads this comment if you want to have nice vacation DO NOT STAY THIS HOWARD JOHNSON!!!!!!!! i also know his name but im not giving his name here. i will never ever recommend that howard johnson to anybody and i will always complain about it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location in toronto”
Reviews.Author: littlebites3
Reviews.Content: Don't believe what you read!! Very good value, not the cleanest, great breakfast, street car stops right in front of Hotel. There is a Mcdonalds next door and convience store across the street. I would recommend staying here for the price not bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: mimicuchi
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel knows that if you go inside, you won't stay. This is the reason they offer 30% off in 3 days stay. Very atractive for people don't know this horrible place. After you arrive and see all around or go to undescriptibles room, you will never can cancel and have your money back. No choice....stay in there frustaded or gift them your money just for nothing. I will never come back and I will never recommend this hotel. When I see that appear somebody telling something diferent or saying that this is a very good place, even a good place, I know for sure that is somebody instructed for them to do it.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: enterthecellardoor17
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed for the weekend and it was horrible. there is no place to even park your car for the 10 mins to check in and unload your luggage. you have to park over 2 blocks away in an underground garage. the area is not nice and on multiple occasions i had homeless people asking me for money. the breakfast is the TRUE definition of continental. it consists of cereal and toast. there is nothing else. there also arent may restaurants nearby that dont look shetchy. i picked this hotel because it was cheaper, but it ended up being more expensive. it is far away from downtown so you have to either park downtown and pay, take a taxi, or take public transportation, which was under construction near the hotel so you had to change buses half way through your route. i ended up waiting over an hour for the bus many times. it would have been a much better idea to pay the extra money to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do business with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kim201034433
Reviews.Content: I made a telephone reservation in April 2010 for a two week trip in October 2010. It was only when I got the confirmation e-mail the next day that the no refund, no cancellation policy was revealed, and they had already charged my card without my consent. I have been protesting this charge in writing since April; my most recent letter was to the Ontario Restaurant Hotel and Motel Association, 2600 Skymark Avenue, Ste. 8-201, Mississauga, Ontario, Canada. This is the regulating government agency for hotels, motels, and restaurants in the province of Ontario. If you've had a bad experience with this property, be it with reservations or actually staying there, I encourage you to write your own complaint letter to ORHMA. The HoJo picked the wrong American to mess with!

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: izzyizzy1
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible. When I booked the room I specifically asked about parking because I was with my handicapped mother. I was told that parking was not a problem. Well it is no problem if you don't mind parking two blocks away in the ghetto and walking back to the hotel while carrying a thirty pound oxygen tank. There are no elevators so again getting to the room was a problem. When I told the front desk clerk that there was no way that we could stay there he said there were no cancellations. The manager was not there, of course, but I insisted that the clerk get him on the phone. I spoke to the manager and expressed my displeasure and he said that he would cancel the room and there would be no charge to my credit card. Well I opened my bill today and guess what the charge was still there!!!! After another 30 minute phone call to the hotel and hotels.com it turns out that I have to call back at 7 am tomorrow morning. The same clerk can't find my cancellation info and now I need to talk to the manager again. By the way this same clerk gave me a cancellation number which he wrote down himself and now he says that the number is not valid. So long story short DO NOT book this hotel unless you want to park in the ghetto and walk to blocks with your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PRICE,AMAZING PEOPLE,AMAZING ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: Ciem
Reviews.Content: I went there last monday with my boyfriend, and we stayed there for one night. They are really friendly and always smiling. Outside of the hotel, doesnt look very nice, but when you go inside its a very pleasant and beautiful place. Our room number was 201, Its the King's Bedroom. The room/space is hellah BIG! We payed $100.57 and we deposit $50. The place is quiet, safe and also clean. They also have a free breakfast: bread toast, muffins,fruits,coffe,juice,bagels. I really really love this hotel and my boyfriend and I miss the place already, I will DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK AGAIN! I recommend this to anyone :)

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Toronto Lakeshore
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Roncesvalles Avenue | King St West & Queensway, Toronto, Ontario M6R 2K3, Canada
